captions.text:
- Whatever we do the
south goes way harder.
and then it's just nap time.
- I'm really excited for sweet tea,
because I feel like ladies like sweet tea,
and I've always wanted to be a lady.
- Okay, I thought it was animal.
- It looks like a banana pepper.

- [woman on right] Yeah.
- [woman on left] Mmm.

- [woman with long
brown hair] What's this?

- [woman with purple hair]
Yeah, a little peanut.

- [woman with long brown
hair] Little peanuts?
- It looks like a cartoon of
like what a little poop would look like.
- I don't like that it's wet.

- A weird brownie, that's
what it feels like.

Maybe it would be would be
with ketchup or like a sauce.

- Yeah, it's like a sandier
cousin of the hamburger.

- I could see myself cuttin'
open one of these biscuits,
- Can you give us like five minutes?

- It's not your typical deli
ham you see in the supermarket.

- You guys are on some
next level (bleep) here.
- It's like a hug from the Lord.

- What would happen if I
replaced my morning coffee
- Oh here's something that tastes good.
We'll soak it in butter and gravy.

- [woman with long brown
hair] Oh it's a moon pie.
There's like three cookies in one.
- Looks like a s'mores on steroids.
- Oh, try and take this away from me.

- That's probably the
thickest cookie I've ever had.
- It's a lot to bite into.

- I could see like every
third grader in the south

like just having one of
these in their lunch boxes.

- This is something where
I'm like,"Oh I like this."
Is this the best thing I've ever eaten?

No, but if you tried
to take it away from me
- I think all southern food feels like

- I think there's something
to be said for this food

- California needs to
step it up a little bit.
Everything that we're doing is like,
"How can we add kale to it?"

- I think southern food makes
you happy while you eat it,
and then right afterwards you're like,
- And then you're happy while you nap.
Then you wake up you're cranky,
and you just eat again and you're happy.

title: Americans Try Southern Food For The First Time

comments.text: Are moon pies the same as wagon wheels???﻿
comments.author: Ellie Baird

comments.text: I am from the south but I haven't heard of half that shit.﻿
comments.author: salty pringles

comments.text:
They missed some of the best ones. Y'all need to fly someone's southern 
momma to come cook y'all some home cooked food. Country fried steak, 
biscuits with sausage gravy, homemade pies. The list goes on ﻿
comments.author: Camryn Elizabeth

comments.text:
Are Moon Pies from the south?? We have them in Colorado.. They're my 
childhood..﻿
comments.author: Indi Jones

comments.text:
Did anyone else take note when they said "California needs to step it up, 
man." That means BuzzFeed is in California! Too bad I move in Georgia 😓﻿
comments.author: Hadana Haile

comments.text: The really need to serve the Moon Pie with RC Cola or Grapico.﻿
comments.author: Perry Cross

comments.text: I love red eye gravy.... Yummmmm ﻿
comments.author: Nicole Guarnera

comments.text:
What about actual fried chicken and making the gravy from the bits of meat 
stuck to the skillet?! Biscuits and gravy that you have the next day? No! 
Bad BuzzFeed! 

What they don't realize is that so much love and work go into these foods 
we dang well enjoy them when they are done.﻿
comments.author: Stevie Redd

comments.text:
I live in Louisiana and I am 14 and I have to say I didn't know that moon 
pies are considered southern food. Also we do not always drink tea out of 
jars. We are human, we use cups people. But I see what they were trying to 
do. Oh BuzzFeed I think you should do a video on like Souther Accents. 
Cause we say weird words. Like buggy, y'all, ect. Overall I love this 
video.﻿
comments.author: Lexi A

comments.text:
"its like a hug from the lord."
at least one of them gets it.﻿
comments.author: Joseph Williams

comments.text: Funny that the Okra wasn't fried, hahah. Pickled Okra is so tight though.﻿
comments.author: aa72on

comments.text:
At eat most of this on a daily basis.... but y'all are forgetting a whole 
lot﻿
comments.author: silver pandas

comments.text:
NEVER IN MY LIFE have I even seen Liver mush and I was born and raised in 
the south. Fucking gross. Pickled okra? Try fried okra instead much better.﻿
comments.author: djkoz78

comments.text:
Why do I have a crush on the guy with the Blue buzzfeed hat? 😂
I live in LA & I'm always hoping I'll see him at like Ralph's or City Wok 
or something hahaha﻿
comments.author: Britneygee

comments.text:
Lmfao i love how they got all happy eating southern food being that I'm 
from the south.......yes the food is made with love and passion lol and 
when they started dancing Omfg i couldn't stop smiling and laughing ﻿
comments.author: morgan taylor

comments.text: Moon Pies! YAY!﻿
comments.author: sadie holguin

comments.text:
Who picked these foods? Almost none of these are quintessentially Southern! 
We have a super diverse food array down here, but there are definitely some 
dishes that tie us together. I've had a MoonPie maybe twice in my life, 
haha. I get the boiled peanuts though. You need better sources, Buzzfeed!﻿
comments.author: Maggie B.

comments.text:
Spent most of my life in the south. Where is the Grits? Chicken and 
Biscuits? Sausage Gravy? They missed all the good foods. ﻿
comments.author: The.New.Eminem2014

comments.text: no fried catfish? everywhere i go its always offered.﻿
comments.author: andres daniel

comments.text: All my North Carolina and New Orleans beauties show yourselves﻿
comments.author: Taylor Rooks

comments.text:
I have my first Moon Pie while in TN, and I have to admit, it was the best 
fucking thing ever.﻿
comments.author: Paige Marie Conners

comments.text: I live in the south. Fun﻿
comments.author: CraftyCreature

comments.text: I'm from Texas. Being as southern as they get, I've never had any of this﻿
comments.author: Corbyn Gan

comments.text:
Damn, after seeing that they have never had boiled peanuts I'm never

comments.text: Our ham. Is basically. God turned. Into food.﻿

comments.text: I am ALL southern and I have to say,OUR FOOD IS FRICKING AMAZING.😃﻿

comments.text: Homemade chicken and dumplings?!? ﻿

comments.text: THEY FORGET THE MAC AND CHEESE﻿

comments.text: Why are they acting so brand new* In Kansas you eat like that all the time*﻿

comments.text: No chitlins? blasphemy.....﻿

comments.text: "It's like a hug from the Lord." I laughed so hard at this.﻿

comments.text: I LOVE Pickled Okra ﻿
comments.author: Brittney Nelson

comments.text:
Im southern , and not to look mean but , you want SWEET tea , us 
southerners put 4-6 cups of sugar in a pitcher .And finish making sweet tea 
. 😁 ~BAMM~ sweet tea.﻿
comments.author: Aiyana Bachelder

comments.text: Pickled pigs feet.  Go for it.﻿
comments.author: therandomdot

comments.text:
Moon pies are amazing when you stick them in the microwave and then eat 
them hot with vanilla ice cream.

The diabetes is so real!﻿
comments.author: Ryan Suddeth

comments.text: That is not southern food﻿
comments.author: Music,makeup,and more

comments.text:
i like that they tried to show ALL southern food even though it doesnt 
work. the south has many regions and each region has different cuisine. 
texas cuisine is very different from appalachian cuisine which is different 
from mississippi cuisine. people in appalachia wont be eating alligator.﻿
comments.author: SnowWhite

comments.text: Isnt okra lady finger??﻿
comments.author: Juriz Ampong

comments.text: man all you people do is criticize.﻿
comments.author: Megan Claire

comments.text:
I'm from Eastern Kentucky and I've never ate anything from the video except 
moon pies. Lol ﻿
comments.author: Acacia Hall

comments.text:
Nice job BuzzFeed! Except you forgot: fried catfish, bbq, fried frog legs, 
crab, oysters, biscuit and gravy, and many, many more things. Oh and did 
the sweet tea come from a jumbo sized pickle jar (that's been cleaned)? 
Didn't think so. Did you let the tea sit out in the sun for 2 days? 
Probably didn't. But other than that you did well!﻿
comments.author: Equestrian Jumper

comments.text:
Born in AL, lived in FL and TN, have traveled to three different 
continents...(Just to relay that I am open-minded) What in the hell is 
liver mush? Also, try a Moonpie warmed up!﻿
comments.author: GBS

comments.text: You're not a secret redneck you're just a person who ate good food﻿
comments.author: Nate Hamann

comments.text:
I come from Southeast Lousiana by way of New Orleans. Besides the country 
ham and biscuits, I've never had some of these foods. To think that I've 
tasted all of what the South has to offer, but apparently not.﻿
comments.author: Cherry Brown

comments.text:
Where are you people from? I see people commenting about never having or 
knowing about boiled peanuts. I see them everywhere. And I live in Georgia 
so.......... And I don't know how you people( non-southerners) live without 
sweet tea. It's amazing﻿
comments.author: Jocelyn Hidalgo

comments.text: It would be nice to see them try real soul food.﻿

comments.text:
How have you southerners never had pickled okra??? It's on almost every 
buffet in biloxi. Has been my entire life. And they are usually in our 
bloody Mary's...﻿

comments.text: Should have done fried okra instead. It's okramazing.﻿

comments.text: They should call these videos: 6-10 People Try *_* Food For The First Time﻿

comments.text:
Southern food is made with "love". And what I mean by "love" is they'll 
lick the spoon and keep on stirring. Its also made with diabetes (butter, 
lard, and/or tons of sugar). I love southern food. Not joking... Love it﻿

Americans try New England food!!! Get some stuffed quahogs, lobster rolls,

comments.text:
Funny video obviously it was comedy purposes and was not an actual list, 
I'm 31 born and raised in texas don't eat oakra ( sister and girlfriend

Only thing I eat on that list is ham

I call redo need new list.
Really wtf boiled peanuts

﻿

comments.text:
Yes you are correct. The slaves made them because the slave masters gave 
them the scraps of the animal they didn't want. They're good but makes the

comments.text: +jviie57 Pig intestines! I believe slaves were the ones who made it.
comments.author: Mallory C

comments.text: How about some Chicken Bog﻿
comments.author: Blake Richa93

comments.text:
I think the only damn thing on that list that we really eat is moon pies.. 
and mostly only around Mardi Gras. and country ham on special occasions.  

BUZZ FEED stop making videos you know nothing about! You're next "Southern" 
video must show your sources and you need more than one "southern" person 
that hasn't lived down here in 15 years...and enough with the fake southern 
accents. That's like slapping us in the face RUDE. We are nice people, send 
one person with a camera to like south Mississippi restaurants or popular 
areas and you'll get more than you ever wished for.  Stop giving us false 
advertisement!!﻿
comments.author: Molly Raborn

comments.text: Yall no nuthin of a redneck ﻿

From: The south.﻿

ew. Moon Pies are so gross. Granted, I haven't had one since I was a child

oh, come on! You have to eat a moon pie with a RC cola. Everyone knows

served moon pies (the non chocolate ones) every single day for dessert at

comments.text:
The only thing from this video that I've tried/heard of was the boiled

comments.text: Im from louisiana. We eat good shit down here﻿
